Key Match Events: Conine collected three hits and one RBI
Xzavion Curry pitched five strong innings
Jonah Bride produced a two-out RBI single
Conine followed with an RBI double to right in the first
Dane Myers settled for a two-run double off the top of the right-field wall
Conine added a single in the eighth
Myers' three-run homer capped a five-RBI performance
Pre-Game Insights: Conine hoped to play at the Blue Jays’ home ballpark one day

Acting manager Luis Urueta said, 'Getting comfortable. Today was tough. They faced a couple lefties -- even [Jesús] Sánchez -- and they did a great job. So I think for them, it's young guys in the big leagues getting comfortable, taking the experience. And they have the talent.'
Post-Match Reflections: Conine said, 'Spraying the ball to all sides of the field is what Conine is most proud of in his maturation as a batter'

Myers said, 'I love his game. We talk a lot about hitting, and I think we have similar approaches, similar swings. Griffin's a true pro. Obviously, he's got a little help from his dad being such a seasoned vet like he was, but Griff's a good guy. He deserves all the success that he's getting, and it's fun to watch him play baseball.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Conine was involved in Miami’s rallies in the first, sixth and eighth innings
Conine collected two RBIs on a broken-bat single to right in the fourth and went deep to left to open the seventh against southpaw Easton Lucas on Friday
Myers admitted this last set was his World Series, as he works to prove himself to the organization after fracturing his left ankle by kicking a clubhouse door on July 13
Conine finished second in the Minors with 36 homers three years ago, but hit just.218 and struck out 185 times
Others: Conine was Minor League teammates with Miami second baseman Otto Lopez from 2018-19 in Toronto’s organization
The 27-year-old Conine was involved in Miami’s rallies in the first, sixth and eighth innings
